title: These titles provide an overview, at least, within one or more core sweb technology areas

note: by Michael C. Daconta, Leo J. Obrst, and Kevin T. Smith,
title: Spinning the Semantic Web: Bringing the World Wide Web to Its Full Potential
MIT Press, 2002 (Foreword by Tim Berners-Lee) The Semantic Web: A Guide to the Future of XML, Web Services, and Knowledge Management
A Semantic Web Primer, by Grigoris Antoniou and Frank van Harmelen

publisher: Dieter Fensel, Frank van Harmelen, and Frank van Harmelen, John Wiley & Sons
title: Towards the Semantic Web: Ontology-Driven Knowledge Management, by John Davies
Semantic Web: A Field Guide, by Thomas B

publisher: Singh and Michael N. Huhns, John Wiley & Sons
title: Service-Oriented Computing: Semantics, Processes, Agents, by Munindar P
The following books take more technical approaches to specific areas
XML Databases and the Semantic Web, by Bhavani Thuraisingham and Bhavani Thuraisingha
Creating the Semantic Web with RDF: Professional Developer’s Guide, by Johan Hjelm
Ontologies: A Silver Bullet for Knowledge Management and Electronic Commerce, by Dieter Fensel
Ontological Engineering with examples from the areas of Knowledge Management, e-Commerce and the Semantic Web, by Asuncion Gomez-Perez, Mariano Fernandez-Lopez, and Oscar Corcho
Other sweb /AI-related Internet Based Workflow Management: Towards a Semantic Web, by Dan C
Web Intelligence, by Ning Zhong, Jiming Liu, and Yiyu Yao
Visualizing the Semantic Web, by Vladimir Geroimenko and Chaomei Chen
The Description Logic Handbook: Theory, Implementation and Applications

note: Scientific American special issue, May, 2001, by Tim Berners-Lee, James Hendler and Ora Lassila (also see SciAm Web site: www.sciam.com/2001/0501issue/0501berners-lee.html). The seminal article for greater developer, and to some extent public, awareness.
title: Some longer descriptions of various sweb technologies have been published in various periodicals over the past few years. ‘The Semantic Web’
Ontologies and the Semantic Web for E-learning’
The journal addresses education issues. ‘Ontology specification languages for the Semantic Web’, Asuncion Gomez-Perez, and Oscar Corcho
Most issues of this periodical have one or more articles relating to intelligent agents and other aspects of sweb technology
Web architecture Architecture of the WWW
